monograph.title: On crossing the Atlantic for Code.
monograph.body:
Jonathan is a practitioner of the digital arts currently stationed in the Redwood City outpost. He spends his days translating British sensibilities, such as "doing a job properly the first time", into the frantic dialects of Silicon Valley.

He treats software architecture like a Victorian garden: it requires structure, constant pruning, and a deep respect for the underlying soil.

chronicle.desc: Explored LLM-automated code implementation. Enabled autonomous defect resolution via deep project context analysis.
Architected the 'MAUI' continuous testing framework for live streaming and directed the selection of developer productivity measurement.
Led international team to bootstrap chat ingestion. Developed POC for insights before pursuing stable ventures.
Serverless Functions & Data Pipeline. Managed 36 billion messages daily via Kafka; at the time one of the largest scale deployments in the industry.
Seventeen-year tenure spanning Hursley Labs and Silicon Valley. Pioneered Complex Event Processing (CEP) patterns for the WebSphere ecosystem.
